title: Data in the smart city: How incongruent frames challenge the transition from ideal to practice
research_description: This study explores the challenges faced by the technical administration in Copenhagen in translating an idealised smart-city vision into practical data governance. Using interviews, focus groups, and workshops, the paper identifies two incongruent technological frames that shape how different actors in the administration perceive and use data in the smart-city paradigm.
research_results: The study found two incongruent technological frames: the 'experimentalist's credo,' which views data as open and useful for agile experimentation, and the 'data owner's vocation,' which treats data as political and context-dependent. These frames highlight the complexities of integrating smart-city ideals into public administration.
future_research: Future research could investigate how other smart-city projects address the incongruences in data governance and explore how technological frames influence the implementation of smart-city initiatives in different cities.
